result.execSummary:
The defendant Terri L Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payment plan is $25 per month with the first payment due the 1st of the month 60 days after release from the treatment facility, and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terri L Arndt

records.addlTxt:
State by Strittmater by zoom /  Def in custody in Richland Co. w/ Atty Fudge by zoom
Def on PO Hold - will be going to treatment @ Ark in Milwaukee for  6 mos
Plea Quest & Waiver e/filed - def understands
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
Fudge:  there was no Prelim Hrg Waiver...
CRT advises def on right to Prelim Hrg
Def Waives Right to Prelim Hrg
CRT finds Waiver is FV&I made 
State relies on Complaint for factual basis
CRT finds def's plea is FV& I made - factual basis exists to accept plea - finds def guiolty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  2 days CJ w/ credit for 2 days - TIME SERVED;  Pay mandatory Crt costs/fees of $443 - pymt plan starts 60 days after release date from trmt - $25 per month w/ 1st pymt to be made 60 days after release from trmt facility

11:32 AM No appearance by Def - Atty Zachariah D Fudge present.  Courtney Kay Strittmater appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Fudge - I schedule this matter for a plea next week and can take the waiver at that time. 
Court will find good cause to go beyond time limits. 
PLEA:  set w/SLH
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:05 am   Defendant Terri L Arndt not in court. Attorney Zachariah D Fudge.  Attorney Courtney Kay Strittmater in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Fudge:  Ms. Arndt went to the Richland Co. jail last week and they gave her a sig. bond there.  She's still in custody there so she must be on a PO hold.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
PH:  5/11 at 11:00 am    SLH
